title: The new Cho'gath is absolutely ridiculous...
body:
I never had a problem with the old Cho'gath... he wasn't amazing and definitely deserved a tune up to make him relevant but he's just stupid now.

Before his mini-rework, Cho'gath's gimmick was that if you played well and didn't die, you had a large health pool which is fine. I'm not even upset about the fact that it stacks infinitely now. if a Cho'gath gets to a point where he has enough health for it to be ridiculous after going 10/0, good on him. 

The problem is the fact that his stacks don't drop off anymore. It's stupid that a Cho'gath can go 0/10 in lane, get a few lucky executes in with a health pool that is already stupid cause you can eat minions to 6 stacks (which is fine by itself) and then be invincible and have true damage that scales with that invincibility. 

And before anyone says build last whisper or something along those lines, it makes no difference when he has a health pool that compares to the dragon in addition to his 400 armour cause his team will kill you and you can't ignore him because he does damage too. 

In summary, Cho'gath needs to either stack infinitely and be able to be shut down and lose his stacks or be capped at 6 permanent stacks because having both is absolutely toxic and there's no way to play around it like there is with other infinitely stacking champs like Nasus or Veigar.

i mean, late game he is massive, so i guess he becomes a skillshot sponge anyway.

also cho'gath actually had some really good utility for his team compared to nasus. His silence is really impactful, his q is nice for making picks or just disrupting a teamfight and he actually does alot more damage than traditional tanks, his ult damage is a bit strong now though. He's also not that easy to kite out if he gets to the point where he's massive since he'll be with his team absorbing all the damage whilst forcing you to try to not get knocked up.

Kiting out a nasus, or even a darius or garen isn't so bad because they're really short range but cho'gath can q behind you, w infront and then walk towards you, zoning you quite hard and in teamfights, if you aren't well positioned or have a good tanky frontline, then you're probably going to be forced to burn flash.

I kinda don't like how strong they've made cho'gath, and cho'gath was the first champion I ever mained.
